key_channel_insights.line_content: 95.15% of routes were priced higher on OTAs last week, commanding a modest average uplift of 0.29% versus Frontier’s website.
MSE undercut Frontier’s site on 28.0% of itineraries last week, marking an 18.5% increase over the prior month, while surcharges fell sharply to 52.9%.
95.27% of GDS listings carried a premium over Frontier’s site last week, averaging a 0.28% uplift with undercuts in only 0.98% of cases.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 95.15% of routes were priced higher on the OTA last week, commanding an average premium of 0.29% over the airline’s site.
Only 1.33% of itineraries showed lower OTA fares last week, up 0.52pp versus the prior week.
3.52% of origin–destination pairs were absent on the OTA last week, a slight 0.12pp dip week-on-week but a 0.40pp rise month-on-month.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 3.52% of ODs had no OTA offer last week, down 0.12pp from the prior week but up 0.40pp versus last month.
Fares matched between the OTA and the airline site in 0.00% of cases last week, a 0.23pp decrease week-on-week.
95.15% of routes carried higher fares on the OTA last week, a 0.16pp decline week-on-week with an average uplift of 0.29%.
Only 1.33% of itineraries were cheaper on the OTA last week, up 0.52pp week-on-week with discounts averaging 0.20%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 96.43% priced higher on the OTA last week, with a 0.30% average premium and only 1.09% receiving discounts.
91.46% of long-haul itineraries were higher on the OTA last week, carrying a 0.23% premium while discounts rose to 2.02%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 96.35% of US-origin routes appeared at a premium on the OTA last week, with a 0.29% average uplift and 1.24% showing discounts.
Non-US itineraries showed 78.63% priced higher on the OTA, with a 0.24% premium and 2.56% receiving discounts.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Within 0–14 days of departure, 94.71% of fares were higher on the OTA last week, with a 0.26% average premium and 0.67% discounted.
Bookings made 90+ days out saw 96.12% priced higher on the OTA, with a 0.34% premium and 2.77% lower-priced fares.

mse_highlights.line_content: Last week MSE undercut Frontier’s site on 28.0% of itineraries, an 18.5% increase versus the previous month.
Instances of MSE listing higher prices fell to 52.9% last week, down roughly 30% compared to both the prior week and month.
Identical pricing on MSE held steady at 19.0%, up 15.2% week-over-week and 12.2% month-over-month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE listings not found on Frontier’s site remain negligible at 0.12%, with no meaningful change week-over-week.
Exactly matching fares account for 19.0% of listings, a 15.2% weekly gain reflecting improved parity.
The share of itineraries where MSE prices exceed website fares declined from 83.6% to 52.9% week-over-week, with an average premium of 0.26%.
Itineraries where MSE undercuts the site climbed from 12.5% to 28.0% week-over-week, delivering an average discount of 0.16%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, MSE undercuts site fares in 29.9% of cases, up 17.6% week-over-week, while higher-price listings plunged 32.9%.
Long-haul saw discounts in 22.5% of itineraries, up 9.6% week-over-week, alongside a 24.5% drop in surcharge instances.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For US departures, MSE underpricing occurs in 29.1% of itineraries, up 16.2% week-over-week, and surcharge cases fell by 31.4%.
Non-US routes show limited MSE discounting at 12.9%, a modest 4.5% weekly increase, while higher-price listings declined 20.9%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Tickets booked within 14 days see the highest discount rate at 30.2%, up 13.8% week-over-week, and a 27.8% drop in surcharge listings.
Far-out bookings carry the highest surcharge rate at 57.9%, down 37.0% week-over-week, with undercuts at 23.4%.

gds_highlights.line_content: 95.27% of all itineraries in GDS last week were priced above Frontier’s website, underscoring a marked premium.
GDS higher-priced listings climbed by 1.87pp week-over-week, delivering a 0.28% average premium consistent with the monthly trend.
Itineraries booked far in advance showed the highest GDS premium at 0.35% on average, with 96.86% priced above the site.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 3.75% of routes lacked a GDS offering last week, slightly down from 3.88% the prior week.
No itineraries displayed exact price parity between the website and GDS last week, indicating systematic deviations.
95.27% of itineraries were higher-priced on GDS last week, up 1.87pp week-over-week with a 0.28% premium.
Only 0.98% of itineraries were cheaper in GDS versus the website, down 1.45pp week-over-week with a −0.18% average discount.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 96.89% of short-haul routes were higher-priced in GDS last week, up 2.06pp week-over-week with a 0.30% average premium.
90.58% of long-haul routes carried a GDS premium, rising 1.45pp week-over-week and averaging a 0.23% uplift.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97.65% of US ODs were higher-priced in GDS last week, a 2.06pp gain week-over-week, with a 0.28% average premium.
62.93% of non-US routes were higher in GDS last week, yielding a 0.26% premium, while only 2.59% registered lower prices.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94.54% of itineraries booked close-in were higher-priced in GDS, up 3.18pp week-over-week with a 0.25% uplift.
96.86% of far-out bookings carried a GDS premium, down 0.95pp week-over-week but with the highest uplift of 0.35%.
